business.headline: Excelsoft Technologies IPO Opens on November 19: Check GMP and price bandFounded in 2000, Excelsoft Technologies is known for its tech-led solutions in the education and assessment industry.

Why chasing every new IPO can hurt your portfolioChasing every new IPO may feel exciting, but it often does more harm than good. Many recent listings have slipped below their issue price, showing that hype doesn't always translate into real returns.

PhysicsWallah shares up 40% over IPO price: Should you sell or hold?The stock opened at Rs 145 on the NSE and Rs 143.10 on the BSE, giving investors a 33% premium over the issue price of Rs 109. This opening surprised market participants, as the GMP trend had pointed to only a mild gain ahead of the listing.

Has your tax refund been delayed? CBDT chief explains whyIf you're still waiting for your income-tax refund, you're not alone. The CBDT chief has clarified why some payouts are taking longer this year and what the department is doing to speed things up.

Digital gold firms knock on Sebi's door, seek regulatory supervision: ReportWith digital gold gaining traction across India, questions around safety and regulation are becoming louder. Industry bodies and platforms now want formal oversight to boost trust in the fast-growing segment.

PhysicsWallah makes strong market debut as shares list at 33% premiumPhysicsWallah share price: The stock listed at Rs 145 on the NSE and Rs 143.10 on the BSE, marking a sharp 33% premium over its issue price of Rs 109.

Narayana Murthy now cites Chinese 9-9-6 system to back 72-hour work week callIn a recent interview, the 79-year-old billionaire referred to China's well-known 9-9-6 work culture to support his long-held view that young Indians should work longer hours to help India grow faster.

Sensex, Nifty fall in early trade amid a cautious start on Dalal StreetThe S&P BSE Sensex slipped 136 points to 84,814.95 around 9:34 am, while the Nifty50 fell 49.95 points to 25,963.50. Sectoral indices were mixed, reflecting the cautious tone among investors.

Why gold, silver prices are falling today and what to expect nextIn India, gold and silver prices also reflected this weakness. As of Tuesday morning, 24-karat gold was priced at Rs 12,343 per gram and Rs 1,23,430 per 10 grams.

PhysicsWallah IPO listing: GMP bounces back, but will investors actually gain?Despite the company's strong brand presence and loyal student base, its IPO received a modest subscription, suggesting that investor sentiment remains cautious.

You're applying for IPOs. But are you funding growth or just promoter exits?The IPO market looks hotter than ever, but the rise of OFS-led offerings reveals a trend most retail investors rarely pause to examine. In Part 2 of The Great IPO Gamble series, we break down what's changing beneath the hype.

US says sanctions on Rosneft and Lukoil already cutting Russia's oil revenueThe US Treasury says sanctions on Russian oil majors are lowering revenues and sales. The two largest buyers of Russian oil have been China and India.

Is it possible to improve your credit score without owning a card?Many people assume that a credit card is essential for building a good credit score. But experts say that's not true. With the right financial habits and timely repayments, you can strengthen your credit profile even without owning a card.

India-US trade deal nearing first-phase closure as tariff talks progress: ReportIndia and the US are negotiating a bilateral trade agreement. So far, six rounds of talks have been completed. Both sides have announced plans to finalise the first tranche of the deal by fall of 2025.

The hidden risk in 'diversified' portfolios: Expert explainsThe idea that "more products mean more safety" is common among investors, but it can be misleading. An expert's recent client case shows why portfolios that look balanced may still be exposed to the same underlying risk.

Ever heard of Birkin Bag Hedge Fund? Check the details hereBy focusing on colours and styles that sell the fastest, the fund aims to keep its turnover high and returns steady. Its strategy also reflects how the luxury resale market has matured into a serious business, where handbags are now viewed as long-term investment assets.
Sensex ends 388 points higher, Nifty above 26,000; Eternal gains 2%The S&P BSE Sensex gained 388.17 points to close at 84,950.95, while the NSE Nifty50 added 103.40 points to end at 26,013.45.

Who is Groww founder Lalit Keshre, who just turned billionaire after IPO?Groww, which started in 2016 as a simple idea to make investing easy for young Indians, is now one of the country's most valuable fintech firms.

Anil Ambani offers to give virtual statement in money laundering caseReliance Group chairman Anil Ambani has offered to give his statement through video conference to the Enforcement Directorate, following his absence twice in a FEMA probe related to a 2010 highway project.

US dumps the penny, but some of them can still earn you $5 millionThe US Mint officially ended production of the one-cent coin on November 12. US Treasurer Brandon Beach struck the last penny at the Philadelphia Mint, marking the end of the 232-year-old coin that first entered circulation in 1793.

entertainment.headline: Ranveer's Dhurandhar could be a two-part film, echoing Ramayana plan: Report Ranveer Singh's upcoming film 'Dhurandhar' is reportedly a two-part spy thriller. The first part is scheduled for release on December 5, 2025. The second instalment is likely to arrive in the first half of the following year.

Justin Bieber tells fans everything hurts after painful rib injury During a recent livestream, singer Justin Bieber revealed he suffered a rib injury after a fall from his Onewheel skateboard and provided insight into both his recovery and his relationship with wife Hailey Bieber.

Bigg Boss 19: Gaurav Khanna gets emotional as wife Akanksha brings love. Watch Gaurav Khanna's emotional reunion with his wife Akanksha Chamola became the highlight of 'Bigg Boss 19's' Family Week, bringing a rare moment of warmth inside the tense house.

Zubeen Garg's wife Garima Saikia posts emotional note on late icon's 53rd birthday On Tuesday, Garima Saikia Garg marked her late husband and singer Zubeen Garg's 53rd birthday with a personal tribute on social media.

Priyanka Chopra shares photos with 'legends' Mahesh Babu, Prithviraj. See pics Priyanka Chopra shared new photos with Mahesh Babu and Prithviraj Sukumaran as the trio promoted SS Rajamouli's upcoming film 'Varanasi' with international media. Calling it a "privilege" to work with them, she expressed excitement over the global buzz building nearly a year before release.

Huma Qureshi rejects Kajol and Twinkle's take on infidelity: What is this free pass? Actor Huma Qureshi has disagreed with Kajol and Twinkle Khanna's recent comments defending physical infidelity. The actor's remarks contribute to an ongoing debate sparked by a conversation on the show 'Two Much With Kajol and Twinkle'.

Is Stranger Things inspired by real life? What to know before Season 5 The new season of 'Stranger Things', premiering on November 26, explores its roots in 1980s pop culture and real-life CIA experiments, as the series creators draw from unsettling historic events to shape the show's narrative.

Huma Qureshi flags Bollywood's language crisis: Half the people don't know Hindi Huma Qureshi sparked a renewed debate about Bollywood's growing disconnect from its Hindi-speaking audience, questioning why scripts and conversations on sets are increasingly dominated by English.

Both my darlings are waiting: Rajkummar's speech for wife, newborn wins hearts Rajkummar Rao attended an award ceremony on behalf of his wife, Patralekhaa, days after the couple welcomed their first child, a baby girl, on their wedding anniversary.

Rajinikanth pays last respects to mentor Gopali at his Chennai home Rajinikanth expressed his respect for his acting teacher Gopali by offering a garland after he died due to age-related reasons. Gopali was instrumental in shaping Rajinikanth's acting career during his time at the film training institute.

Odia singer Humane Sagar dies at 36, Chief Minister Mohan Majhi condoles his death Popular Odia playback singer Humane Sagar died at the age of 36 after battling multiple health complications at AIIMS Bhubaneswar.

SS Rajamouli calls for IMAX screens in Hyderabad before Varanasi release in 2027 Director SS Rajamouli has expressed the hope that Hyderabad will see the establishment of 1.43 IMAX screens before the release of his upcoming film 'Varanasi', which is scheduled for 2027. The film features Mahesh Babu, Prithviraj Sukumaran and Priyanka Chopra Jonas.

No one does it like Malfoys: Jason Isaacs joins Tom Felton backstage on Broadway Jason Isaacs and Tom Felton, known for their roles as Lucius and Draco Malfoy in the 'Harry Potter' franchise, reunited backstage at Broadway's 'Harry Potter and the Cursed Child.' The reunion included Aidan Close, who portrays Draco's son Scorpius on stage, marking a unique meeting of three generations of Malfoys.

Live-Action Moana teaser: Catherine takes lead, Dwayne Johnson returns as Maui Disney has released the first teaser for its live-action 'Moana', introducing newcomer Catherine Lagaaia as Moana while Dwayne Johnson returns as Maui. The film aims to honour Pacific Island heritage and will hit theatres on July 10, 2026.

Boney Kapoor not liable to pay interest in loan dispute case: High Court The Bombay High Court has ruled that filmmaker Boney Kapoor is not required to pay interest on a Rs 31 lakh deposit linked to a case under the Maharashtra Protection of Interest of Depositors (MPID) Act.

Dining with the Kapoors: Ranbir the most chaotic cousin, with Elder Sibling vibe Ranbir Kapoor exudes "Elder Sibling" energy in a new promo clip of 'Dining with the Kapoors'. The Netflix special, created by Armaan Jain, aims to capture the family's bonding over food, memories and Raj Kapoor's legacy.

Salman Khan and family at Salim-Salma's 61st anniversary, actor greets paps. Watch Salman Khan joined family members and close friends to celebrate the 61st wedding anniversary of his parents, Salim Khan and Salma Khan, in Mumbai on November 17.

Naina Avtr: India's first AI actor debuts in micro-drama 'Naina Avtr', India's first AI actor, was introduced by Avtr Meta Labs. The AI actor now stars in the micro-drama titled 'Truth & Lies'. She appears alongside human actors on the show.

Piyush Mishra slams Bollywood's unnecessary entourage culture, praises south cinema Piyush Mishra criticised the growing trend of actors travelling with oversized entourages in Bollywood, calling it unnecessary and burdensome. He praised the South film industry for its humility and simplicity, recalling how even top directors like Shankar treated him with respect.

general news.headline: Suicide bombing very misunderstood, says Red Fort bomber in unseen videoIn the unseen footage, the Red Fort bomber talks about the "misunderstood" concept of suicide bombing. He explains that what is often labelled as a suicide bombing is actually a martyrdom operation in Islam.

Top Maoist commander Madvi Hidma, behind 26 deadly attacks, killed in AndhraMadvi Hidma (43), who had a bounty of Rs 50 lakh, was involved in the 2010 Dantewada attack, the 2013 Jhiram Valley massacre and the 2021 Sukma-Bijapur encounter.

I take 100% responsibility: Prashant Kishor as his party scores zero in Bihar debut  UpdatesJan Suraaj Party chief Prashant Kishor accepted responsibility as his party, contesting 238 seats as a touted "dark horse," failed to win any in Bihar.

Why is Sheikh Hasina, not Muhammad Yunus, branded as criminal: Taslima NasreenExiled Bangladeshi author Taslima Nasreen has called out the International Crimes Tribunal's death sentence for ousted Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina, questioning why chief advisor Muhammad Yunus and his aides haven't faced similar scrutiny after last year's student uprising that toppled Hasina's regime.

Pak's repair work, even after 6 months, shows how hard India hitIt has been over six months since India and Pakistan engaged in a four-day war, yet Pakistan has not been able to repair the damage inflicted by Indian forces on its vital installations. OSINT expert Damien Symon's revelations of repairs at the Nur Khan Airbase poke big holes in Pakistan's claims of victory against India in the May conflict.

Will sell F-35s to Saudi Arabia: Trump rolls out red carpet for MBS with eye on ChinaThe Crown Prince is expected to arrive with a wish list that includes receiving formal assurances from Trump defining the scope of the US military protection for the kingdom and an agreement to buy US-made F-35 fighter jets, one of the world's most advanced aircraft.

Gavaskar backs Gambhir: Pitch fine. India batters lacked technique, temperamentIndia vs South Africa: Batting great Sunil Gavaskar backed Gautam Gambhir's claim that the Eden Gardens pitch used for the series opener had no demons. India failed to chase 124 in the final innings and lost the series opener by 30 runs on a pitch where free-flowing strokemaking was not posssible.

Delhi blast co-conspirator had backed out of fidayeen attack: Suicide is sinA political science student, Bilal had been radicalised for suicide bombing since 2023 by Umar, arrested doctors revealed during interrogation.

Narayana Murthy now cites Chinese 9-9-6 system to back 72-hour work week callIn a recent interview, the 79-year-old billionaire referred to China's well-known 9-9-6 work culture to support his long-held view that young Indians should work longer hours to help India grow faster.

In fresh plea, Karisma Kapoor's children claim Priya forged father Sunjay's willKarisma Kapoor's children have alleged that their late father Sunjay Kapur's will is forged and fabricated, and have sought an examination of its authenticity.

Trump backs release of Epstein Files. What's behind this U-turn?In a surprise U-turn, US President Donald Trump has asked House Republicans to vote for the release of the Epstein Files. This is what led to Trump's change of stance on the documents linked to the convicted paedophile and trafficker.

Update your Arattai app tonight because E2E is coming, says Sridhar VembuIndia's homegrown messaging app, Arattai, is finally getting end-to-end encryption for chats, a feature it lacked compared to WhatsApp. Zoho cofounder Sridhar Vembu has revealed what you need to do to get the feature on your chats on the app.

Little boy aces Hrithik Roshan's Janaab-e-Aali moves, teachers and classmates cheerA video of a little boy dancing to Hrithik Roshan's popular track 'Janaab-e-Aali' from War 2 has delighted the internet.

CGC University, Mohali: Where vision becomes legacy and education becomes evolutionStories of students who dare to dream, of educators who ignite curiosity, and of a community that chooses progress with purpose.

Red Fort blast terrorists had planned Hamas-style drone attacks in Delhi: SourcesThe NIA's probe into the Delhi blast revealed that the accused initially planned rocket bomb and drone-based explosive attacks across high-security zones and were seeking technical experts to execute the plan.

Supreme Court recalls own verdict blocking ex post facto green clearancesThe Supreme Court, in a 2:1 review, set aside its own May 16 verdict that had barred the Centre from granting retrospective environmental clearances.

Rajamouli's atheism and the God question: Can a non-believer create epic tales?SS Rajamouli's declaration that he is an atheist has sparked a fierce backlash from sections of the audience who expect belief to define a filmmaker's right to tell mythological stories. Here's why faith and storytelling are not bound by the same rules.

PhysicsWallah shares up 40% over IPO price: Should you sell or hold?The stock opened at Rs 145 on the NSE and Rs 143.10 on the BSE, giving investors a 33% premium over the issue price of Rs 109. This opening surprised market participants, as the GMP trend had pointed to only a mild gain ahead of the listing.

Video: Man with knife charges at cabbies at Bengaluru airport, caught after chaseA man was arrested for attempting a knife attack on taxi drivers at Kempegowda airport late Sunday night. CISF's quick action prevented a major crime and ensured safety at the airport.

How social media is fuelling the rise of travel dysmorphiaSocial media algorithms do not merely mess with your feed, but have a lasting impact on your bucket list and mental health too. Therefore, people are now also talking about travel dysmorphia and it's not a mental condition.

Maruti Suzuki e Vitara review: Is this the right EV at the right moment?The e Vitara is Maruti Suzuki's quiet step into an electric future, and we drove it a month before its India debut. Not to chase lap times or lightning bolts, but to understand whether this unassuming SUV can translate everyday simplicity into genuine EV maturity. Surprisingly, it nearly does.
Lamborghini bypasses toll booth. Video makes Internet say money can't buy classThe viral video, filmed on a highway in India, shows a Lamborghini driving straight through the toll booth.

Two CRPF schools, local courts in Delhi get bomb threats via Jaish-linked e-mailThe bomb threat e-mail was sent to the CRPF schools in Dwarka and Prashant Vihar, and the Saket and Rohini District Courts. Security personnel carried out checks at the four locations, but failed to find anything suspicious.

Burdened with voter list revision work, Jaipur teacher dies by suicideIn a note, 48-year-old Mukesh Jangid had written that he was under pressure from a supervisor over official tasks linked to the SIR scheme. The note was recovered from his pocket.

Ranveer's Dhurandhar could be a two-part film, echoing Ramayana plan: ReportRanveer Singh's upcoming film 'Dhurandhar' is reportedly a two-part spy thriller. The first part is scheduled for release on December 5, 2025. The second instalment is likely to arrive in the first half of the following year.

Priyanka Chopra shares photos with 'legends' Mahesh Babu, Prithviraj. See picsPriyanka Chopra shared new photos with Mahesh Babu and Prithviraj Sukumaran as the trio promoted SS Rajamouli's upcoming film 'Varanasi' with international media. Calling it a "privilege" to work with them, she expressed excitement over the global buzz building nearly a year before release.

sports.headline: Tore shreds off me: Australia's Khawaja on first encounter with Brendon McCullum Australia opener Usman Khawaja revealed how his first encounter with England coach Brendon McCullum wasn't a pleasant experience. Khawaja said that the former New Zealand wicketkeeper sledged him mercilessly in 2011.

Indian archers stuck in Dhaka for 10 hours: Forced into unsafe, filthy accommodation Indian archers endured a chaotic return from Dhaka after a cancelled flight left them stranded for nearly 10 hours and forced into filthy, unsafe accommodation without any airline support. The ordeal unfolded amid violence in the Bangladeshi capital, putting several minors and women athletes at risk.

England need to win first two Tests to have a chance of winning Ashes: Stuart Broad Former England cricketer Stuart Broad believes that the first two Tests will be key for the side's chances to break Australia's Ashes dominance.

Guwahati Test: Ex-India batter says CSK captain should replace Gill if he's ruled out India vs South Africa: Aakash Chopra has recommended Ruturaj Gaikwad as a replacement if Shubman Gill is ruled out of the second Test in Guwahati. India fielded as many as six left-handers in the first Test in Kolkata, which they lost by 30 runs.

PAK vs ZIM vs SL T20I tri-series: Livestreaming details and all you need to know Pakistan will welcome Zimbabwe and Sri Lanka to Rawalpindi for a T20I tri-series as both teams aim to gain momentum heading into the T20 World Cup next year. All the matches will be played at the Rawalpindi Cricket Stadium.

BAN vs IND: When and where to watch Ryan Williams' debut for Indian football team The latest entry to the Blue Tigers, OCI star Ryan Williams, could make his much-anticipated debut for the Indian football team as India takes on Bangladesh. Here's a quick guide on when the match kicks off and where fans can watch the action live.

Shock defeat spurs India to training in Kolkata before Guwahati trip India vs South Africa: India players and members of the support staff, led by coach Gautam Gambhir, trained at Eden Gardens on Tuesday, getting in a solid hit in the nets. They made the most of the extra days available after the first Test ended inside two-and-a-half days, with the hosts losing by 30 runs.

NZ vs WI: Daryl Mitchell ruled out of series, Nicholls to remain with squad New Zealand face a blow with all-rounder Daryl Mitchell sidelined from the ongoing ODI series against the West Indies due to a groin injury. Henry Nicholls, initially called up for the second ODI, will now remain with the squad for the entire series.

Russell's KKR release wrong, even 4 players like Cameron Green can't cover it: Kaif Mohammed Kaif has claimed that Andre Russell's release from KKR is wrong and said that four Cameron Greens won't be able to fill the void left by the all-rounder. Russell won the IPL twice with KKR during his 12 seasons with the team.

Germany, Netherlands secure World Cup 2026 qualification with big wins Germany secured World Cup 2026 qualification with a dominant 6-0 victory over Slovakia, finishing top of Group A. Netherlands also confirmed their place in the tournament, remaining unbeaten and defeating Lithuania 4-0 to top Group G.

Smithy's mind was racing: Starc on Hazlewood-Abbott injury blow during Shield tie Mitchell Starc revealed the chaos that ensued after Josh Hazlewood and Sean Abbott had to leave the field during the Sheffield Shield match ahead of the first Ashes Test against England. Both Abbott and Hazlewood are ruled out of the match in Perth due to injuries.

They made the most of the extra days available after the first Test ended inside two-and-a-half days, with the hosts losing by 30 runs.

Henry Nicholls, initially called up for the second ODI, will now remain with the squad for the entire series.

Russell won the IPL twice with KKR during his 12 seasons with the team.

Both Abbott and Hazlewood are ruled out of the match in Perth due to injuries.

After Cairo bronze, Esha Singh aims Asian Games: Want to bring glory to my countryEsha Singh made history by winning her first individual senior world‑championship medal, a bronze in the Women's 25 m pistol at the ISSF World Championship in Cairo. In an interview with Sports Today, Esha talked about doing well in the Asian Games next year.

Sri Lanka Cricketers Return From Pakistan Amid Illness And Security Jitters Over Islamabad BlastThis report covers the sudden return of Sri Lankan cricketers, captain Charith Asalanka and pacer Asitha Fernando, from their tour in Pakistan after falling ill. The development occurred amid heightened security concerns raised by the Sri Lankan squad following a recent suicide bombing in Islamabad. The bulletin states, 'The players recalled for medical care as Sri Lanka cricket avoids specifying nature of illness'. This precautionary decision was made to ensure the players receive proper care and have sufficient time to recover.

Rank turner haunting: When India didn't learn from mistakes during home TestsThe Indian team management's decision to go for a rank turner in Kolkata backfired as South Africa secured a historic win in the first Test. But this wasn't the first time this plan has backfired for India.

Will South Africa bring back Kagiso Rabada for Guwahati Test?IND vs SA: Kagiso Rabada didn't play the Kolkata Test, but will the Proteas bring him back for the Guwahati Test with a chance to win a Test series on Indian soil after 25 years?

DRS: Did Gautam Gambhir make the right choice with a rank turner in Kolkata?Gautam Gambhir's decision to request a rank turner at Eden Gardens has sparked debate after India's 30-run defeat. The DRS panel weighs in on whether the strategy suited the team's strengths or exposed its limitations.

FC Barcelona return to home stadium Spotify Camp Nou: First match decidedBarcelona will finally return to the renovated Spotify Camp Nou after more than two seasons away. Their La Liga clash against Athletic Bilbao marks the first match at the revamped stadium since 2023.

Sunil Gavaskar on Eden pitch row: Blame India's batting, not the wicket for defeatOn this special report, Indian cricket legend Sunil Gavaskar weighs in on the controversy surrounding the Eden Gardens pitch after India's Test match loss to South Africa. Gavaskar defends the wicket, aligning with Indian Head Coach Gautam Gambhir, and argues that the focus should be on the Indian team's batting performance rather than the pitch conditions, highlighting South African captain Temba Bavuma's resilient innings as an example to follow. When asked about the pitch, Gavaskar stated, 'I don't think it was a pitch where you get all out for 90 runs like the Indian team did.' He firmly places the responsibility on the batters' temperament and technique, suggesting they failed to apply themselves correctly during the chase.

Am I Harmanpreet Kaur? Bangladesh captain launches brutal attack on India skipperBangladesh captain Nigar Sultana Joty dismissed allegations of assaulting junior players and took a veiled dig at Harmanpreet Kaur while defending herself. In 2023, Harmanpreet was involved in a controversy during the Bangladesh tour.

DRS: Did Gautam Gambhir make the right choice with a rank turner in Kolkata?Gautam Gambhir's decision to request a rank turner at Eden Gardens has sparked debate after India's 30-run defeat. The DRS panel weighs in on whether the strategy suited the team's strengths or exposed its limitations.

Bangladesh captain launches brutal attack on India skipperBangladesh captain Nigar Sultana Joty dismissed allegations of assaulting junior players and took a veiled dig at Harmanpreet Kaur while defending herself. In 2023, Harmanpreet was involved in a controversy during the Bangladesh tour.

Sri Lanka's Asalanka and Fernando return before Pakistan tri-series: Cite illnessSri Lanka captain Charith Asalanka and Asitha Fernando are returning home from Pakistan due to illness. Sri Lanka Cricket clarified the exits are unrelated to security concerns following the recent Islamabad blast.

Leave the curator alone: Sunil Gavaskar's clear verdict on Eden Gardens pitch rowIND vs SA: Former India captain, Sunil Gavaskar believes teams should never interfere with a curator's work after India's Eden Test defeat. He says pitch manipulation can backfire and urges trust in the curator's expertise.

India's Spin Gambit Backfires; Gambhir's Test Coaching Under Fire After Proteas LossThis special report analyses India's 30-run Test match defeat to South Africa at Eden Gardens, a loss that has put coach Gautam Gambhir's red-ball record under scrutiny. The programme delves into the controversy surrounding the spin-friendly pitch, which the Indian team management reportedly requested, and features sharp analysis from former captains Sunil Gavaskar and Sourav Ganguly on the team's batting collapse and overall strategy. Sunil Gavaskar stated, 'It is just poor technique and poor temperament, which has got us into this situation.'

Watch: India, Pakistan players shake hands in Women's T20 World Cup for the BlindIndia and Pakistan players shared a rare handshake after their T20 World Cup for the Blind clash in Sri Lanka, breaking the no-handshake trend that had followed recent encounters between the two sides.

WPL 2026 set to be held in Mumbai, Baroda from January 7: ReportsThe WPL 2026 season is expected to be split between Mumbai and Baroda from January 7 to February 3, with DY Patil Stadium likely to host the opener and Kotambi Stadium set for the final. The auction will take place on November 27.

India should have chased 124 in Eden Gardens Test vs South Africa: Sunil GavaskarIndia legend Sunil Gavaskar believes the hosts should have comfortably chased 124 in the Eden Gardens Test. He said the loss highlighted batting lapses rather than pitch conditions or external factors.

Sourav Ganguly Advises Team India to Play on Good Pitches and Win Tests in 5 DaysThis special report delves into the intense debate over India's Test cricket pitch strategy, featuring analysis from former India captain Sourav Ganguly and cricket legend Sunil Gavaskar. The discussion addresses whether India should prepare turning tracks from day one or opt for good batting pitches that last longer, following a recent loss on a spin-friendly wicket. Sourav Ganguly, the current President of the Cricket Association of Bengal, offered his advice, stating the team should 'win test matches in 5 days, not in 3 days'. The programme explores the differing philosophies, with Gavaskar suggesting curators should be left alone to prepare balanced surfaces, while Ganguly advocates for playing on good pitches against all opponents to build a resilient team.

India batters lacked technique, temperamentIndia vs South Africa: Batting great Sunil Gavaskar backed Gautam Gambhir's claim that the Eden Gardens pitch used for the series opener had no demons. India failed to chase 124 in the final innings and lost the series opener by 30 runs on a pitch where free-flowing strokemaking was not posssible.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
